name: Ultimune Power Infusing Anti-Aging Serum & Refill
about: What it is:A potent, antioxidant face serum that delivers three visible changes in as little as three days: radiance, resilience, and smoothness..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dryness, and Dullness.Highlighted Ingredients:- Fermented Roselle Extract: Increases skinu2019s capacity to hold water for plumper-, more radiant-looking skin..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, and triclosan..What Else You Need to Know:The culmination of over 150 years of Japanese skincare innovation. Discover three visible changes in as little as three days: radiance, resilience, and smoothness. The formula is powered by collagen-supporting peptides as well as nourishing antioxidants to strengthen skin's protective barrier, leaving it visibly smoother and plumper..Clinical Results:In a consumer test with 103 women, after three days:
ingredients: -Fermented Roselle Extract: Increases skinu2019s capacity to hold water for visibly plumper and more radiant skin..-Heartleaf Extract: Soothes and strengthens the protective barrier..-Reishi Mushroom: Rich in antioxidants, it hydrates and visibly reduces signs of aging...Water(Aqua/Eau), Sd Alcohol 40-B (Alcohol Denat.),Glycerin,Butylene Glycol, Dimethicone,Diglycerin,Peg/Ppg-17/4 Dimethyl Ether,Phenoxyethanol,Triethylhexanoin,Isodecyl Neopentanoate,Trehalose,Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/Beheneth-25 Methacrylate Crosspolymer,Peg-14m,Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer,Peg/Ppg-14/7 Dimethyl Ether,Tocopheryl Acetate,Rosa Damascena Flower Water,Alcohol,Fragrance (Parfum),Disodium Edta,Potassium Hydroxide,Silica,Isoceteth-10,Linalool,Lauryl Betaine,Sodium Metabisulfite,Ginkgo Biloba Leaf Extract,Geraniol,Citronellol,Origanum Majorana Leaf Extract,Nelumbo Nucifera Germ Extract,Hydroxyproline,Houttuynia Cordata Extract,Sanguisorba Officinalis Root Extract, Sodium Carboxymethyl Beta-Glucan,Thymus Serpyllum Extract,Bht,Lactobacillus/Hibiscus Sabdariffa Flower Ferment Filtrate,Perilla Ocymoides Leaf Extract,Sodium Bicarbonate,Iris Florentina Root Extract,Sodium Benzoate,Ganoderma Lucidum (Mushroom) Stem Extract.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Use Ultimune after cleansing and softening skin, but before applying any other serums or moisturizers..-Pump twice onto your fingertips..-Smooth evenly over face and neck. .-Use Ultimune twice daily, morning and night. .-Reduce waste with Ultimune refills. .-Save the pump and cap from your original bottle. .-Insert the pump into the refill..-Close cap.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product promises to reduce wrinkles, dryness, and dullness, but I truly did not see that happen. My under eyes are perpetually tired looking, and after receiving this from Influenster I was so excited. I was using a small quarter pump under each eye every evening before bed. I will note that when I went to use the product yesterday after using it around ten or less times nothing would come out. Iu2019m not sure if this is a pump problem or itu2019s just gone so I did not get a full 30 day use out of it. I do have extremely sensitive eyes, and I woke up with some eye gunk and slightly red rimmed eyes a few times after using it. I looked in the mirror today and I really canu2019t see a different in my dark circles or lines or hydration. I will give it the benefit of the doubt in the way that it went on really smoothly, it was cooling under the eyes, and it sunk it very quickly and made my under eyes look hydrated while it was freshly applied. Outside of that I will say that I didnu2019t see much different, but I may chalk it up to not really having time to see if the product really works due to mine running out so quickly. It seems to have amazing reviews elsewhere.

reviews.review_text: My first impressions, I loved the elegant packaging and the pump provides for easy dispensing. It has a serum-like texture with a good slip to it that dries down to a non-sticky, silky finish. I apply after cleansing/ toning before my other serums. It helps your other products absorb better. There was a tiny bit of stinging and itchiness when I first applied. I noticed some of my sun damage got lighter after using this with an AHA serum. My cons would be that this product contains a very high amount of alcohol that makes my eyes sensitive while using the product. At first I thought this was primarily due to a sunscreen I was using, but even after not using them together I still had the same result. It has a floral scent, so if you don't like scented skincare keep that in mind. Overall, the product is great once you get past the stinging.

reviews.review_text: I was surprised by how much I liked this serum.  I actually noticed a difference so soon after I began using it.  No, it didnu2019t get rid of my fine lines or anything like that overnight.  But I noticed on mornings I had slept with it on, that my skin looked much more hydrated and radiant than usual.  The serum is lightweight and absorbs quickly.  It also didnu2019t cause any breakouts or irritate my sensitive skin.  Iu2019m still using the bottle and havenu2019t noticed too much in the way of fine lines, but I donu2019t have a ton, so thatu2019s harder to see the difference.  If youu2019re looking for quick results in anti-aging, maybe look for a different product.  But if youu2019re looking for something to make your skin feel and look radiant and moisturized, this could be a good option!  I honestly think my skin looks really nice when I use it.  Itu2019s more expensive than I would typically purchase, but thereu2019s a very good chance that I will end up repurchasing when I run out.  The fact Iu2019m even considering it means that I really like it a lot.  If youu2019re wanting to try it, I donu2019t think youu2019ll be disappointed!  The bottle is also really nice, if you care about that!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Hydration amplified.  Shisheido gifted me their potent Ultimune Power Infusing Serum to test, and I am happy to report it easily makes my top five best serums list.   A culmination of 150 years of Japanese skincare innovation, NEW Ultimune face serum is full of nutrients and antioxidants including: REISHI MUSHROOM, IRIS ROOT EXTRACT, FERMENTED ROSELLE EXTRACT, AND HEARTLEAF EXTRACT. Itu2019s designed to nourish and strengthen the skin, reduce signs of aging, amplify hydration, and boost radiance.   Iu2019ve been using Ultimune face serum twice a day for 6 weeks, and love the results. The serum has a watery gel like texture that absorbs quickly and easily into my skin. My face drinks it up, and looks instantly softer, firmer, and smoother. To my delight, it works well alongside harsher products in my skincare routine, providing the protection and nourishment I need. It also layers nicely under makeup and makes my foundation look smoother and prettier.   Overall itu2019s an effective, luxurious, do-everything product made with quality ingredients thatu2019s sure to please discerning skincare devotees.   Bonus: It doubles as art.  I love the contemporary lines and feminine color of the bottle so much that I leave it out on the counter to admire it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product from @influenster and @shiseido, and I'm in love! reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I couldnu2019t wait to try this Ultimune Power Infusing Serum from Shisheido.  First off, letu2019s talk about the packaging: the serum comes in a beautiful luxurious glass bottle. The nice thing is that this is refillable, you just hang onto the pump and cap, although the refills are still expensive, but it still cuts down on environmental waste.  The serum itself has a slightly milky, runny gel texture to it, but it blends easily into my skin and absorbs quickly.  It also has a nice perfume (citrus? floral?) scent, thatu2019s not overpowering and doesnu2019t really linger.  The one thing I do want to point out is that, as alcohol is unfortunately one of the main ingredients, I could smell it as I was applying - just a faint smell.  Therefore I was not surprised that it seemed to be a little drying and tightened my skin.  Again, this is a serum, not a moisturizer, so I wouldnu2019t expect that this would be super hydrating,and it is a very lightweight serum that plays well with my moisturizer.  I havenu2019t noticed a profound difference as far as diminished wrinkles, but my complexion is more radiant and firm.  Iu2019m on the fence with this serum, only because for it being high end there shouldnu2019t be alcohol in it.

I really like the texture of this product. It's lightweight and moisturizing and sinks right into the skin. It was very easy to incorporate this product into my skincare routine and I love the fact that it enhances the efficacy of other skincare products you use with it. Overall I've really enjoyed this concentrate and will definitely continue using it.

reviews.review_title: Not moisturizing enough for dry skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I recently received this product and would repurchase this product again, mostly for the experience and not so much for efficacy. Let me explain - I LOVE shiseido. Their essential energy cream is a fantastic moisturizer and the scent is luxurious and fresh, which keeps me going back to it time and time again. This product is similar in that regard - I LOVE the scent. It makes me feel like Iu2019m getting a facial done at a high end spa. I also think the bottle is super sleek and the component is beautiful BUT Iu2019m not fond of the lid since it has to be perfectly placed back on and there were times it would take me a minute to do so. When it comes to the product itself, this serum reminds me of the essential energy gel cream - itu2019s a lightweight gel that would perhaps work for someone who is super oily but not those of us with combo to dry skin. Iu2019ve found that other brands have more moisturizing serums compared to this and I wish it was just a little more thick. I did think it gave me some moisture but outside of that I didnu2019t see a huge difference in my skinu2019s hydration. I also didnu2019t notice any additional brightness. Overall I would stray away from this product if you are dry or combo skin but perhaps it would work well for oily skin.  Note: I received this product from Influenster in exchange for my honest review.

The serum is said to strengthen the skin's protective barrier while minimizing fine lines and wrinkles, features Reishi Mushroom and Iris Extract which are potent antioxidants that shield skin against that oxidative effects of stress, pollution, and urban life, and also hydrates skin intensely. Overall, first impressions were pretty good! The consistency of the product itself was like a thinner gel. Slightly runny and not very thick. It was an opaque white/clear color. And it smelled slightly floral and a bit perfumey, so there was definitely a fragrance to it. It had a nice slip to the skin and moved around the face nice. I used about 2-3 pumps of serum for my entire face daily. day and night in my routine. It did feel nice and very moisturizing on my skin, but it was a little tacky compared to my other serum. I felt that it took a bit longer to set into my skin than other serums I have used. It wasn't necessarily overly greasy or oily but it just took a while to sink into my skin, in my opinion.
